content: Net income for the second quarter and six months ended June 30, 2022 grew by 8.4% and 9.6%, respectively to $12.5 million and $24.6 million when compared to the same period last year. Strong loan originations over the past two quarters increased our period end total loan balance to $3.3 billion, an increase of $230 million or 7.4% when compared to December 31, 2021. Commercial industrial loans, which were $108 million at June 30, 2022, an increase of $17.7 million or 19.5% compared to December 31, 2021 is a key part of our strategic initiatives as we continue to grow our relationship business and further diversify our portfolio. Second, the $119 million floating corporate â floating rate corporate bond portfolio, which reprises quarterly based on a 10 year swap rate, continued to improve with the increase in long-term rates. Non-interest expense came in at $16.4 million for the second quarter, an increase of approximately $600,000 when compared to the same period last year and three months ended March 31, 2022.
